metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0740 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the ImagingLibTiffDecode function inlibImaging/TiffDecode.c in Pillow before 3.1.1 allows remote attackers tooverwrite memory via a crafted TIFF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0740` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-imaging-compat - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2').
